page.title: 06POPULATION (page 2)
page.content: There is a Church of England church on a Saxon site which holds traditional services(matins). A blacksmith repairs farm machinery and does general light engineering. Holmesdale Park,an old people's home, was renovated and sold for{Â£300,000. {The house has many}facilities for the elderly.A week's stay costs from Â£250.The nursing wing houses 42,and the convalescent wing 45.There are 15 acres of land including a croquet lawn and tennis court.Indoors is a hairdresser's and beauty parlour. {Robert Denholm House},formerly Capenor built 1889,is used as headquarters of the{National Christian Education {Council}for training and publishing. The{M23(London-Brighton)}runs to the east, the{M25 (London orbital)}1 mile north. {Gatwick}lies 7 miles south .
